title: How to Use the Red Eye Tool in Photoshop

steps.headline: Put the image that you want up in Photoshop.
steps.description: While editing, you want it as large as you can get it.

steps.headline: In the toolbox, right click on the plaster (band-aid).
steps.description: Click on the icon that looks like an eye and is labeled "Red eye tool".

steps.headline: Click the eyes on your image in order to remove the red eye.
steps.description: You will know when you have done this successfully because you will notice the eyes are no longer flashy and the image looks much better.

steps.headline: You have now removed the redeye and you can now do what you want with the image, get it framed, put it on Facebook, etc.
steps.description: Be sure to downsize it when you are finished.

text: Put the image that you want up in Photoshop. While editing, you want it as large as you can get it. In the toolbox, right click on the plaster (band-aid). Click on the icon that looks like an eye and is labeled "Red eye tool". Click the eyes on your image in order to remove the red eye. You will know when you have done this successfully because you will notice the eyes are no longer flashy and the image looks much better. You have now removed the redeye and you can now do what you want with the image, get it framed, put it on Facebook, etc. Be sure to downsize it when you are finished.
